description:
Hello Bristol Gophers 👋!

We're super excited to continue our series of Golang talks.

Speakers:

🗣️ Thomas Burridge - The Hexagon Paradox: Making a Clean Break from Messy Code

The benefits and drawbacks of Hexagonal and Clean Architecture regarding programming, how it applies to everyday development, and why it should be considered for your next project.

Thomas Burridge runs NearLunar, a group that creates fantastic software. Thomas loves tech, and is good at solving problems. He cares about his work in software development. He's helped Ne­arLunar grow by turning tricky tasks into good, quick software. He knows a lot about different types of technology and how to use them today

🗣️ Alexander Jophus - A Rust vs Go comparison

This is a quick talk on rust vs go, the benefits of both, the drawbacks of both. It's predominantly a prelude to another talk on gamedev (but it's not ready yet).

Alexander Jophus is your friendly (hopefully) meetup organiser. He's still unemployed, but rumour has it that's ending soon.

⏰ Schedule (possibly):

* 18:00-18:15 welcome/pizza/intro
* 18:15-18:45 first speaker
* 18:45-18:50 small break
* 18:50-19:20 second speaker
* 19:15-19:30 farewell/next event info

❤️ Sponsors

* Tumelo (venue)
* Formula Recruitment (food/drinks)

📍 - Runway East
title: Golang Talks @ RWE
